title: How to Prepare Waasung Gudog

steps.headline: Prepare a bamboo stalk chopped open at one end.
steps.description: Ideally it's prepared on 'waanal or waandal' (a class of bamboo with thick skinned and spacious at the same time).

steps.headline: Gudog ingredients can be chosen at one's discretion.
steps.description: Usually it's bamboo shoot, but we'll take an example of potato.....

steps.headline: Take a tbsp of turmeric powder, few onion rings ,a fresh fry (baby fish), chopped potatoes and most importantly green chillies and obviously salt.
Take a plantain leaf and roll it into a ball.
Transfer all the ingredients into the stalk and cover it with the ball of plantain leaf in such a way that it's loose enough to release pressure from the stalk.
Prepare a light fire and place the stalk over it.
Cook it until it boils  for about 10 to 15 minutes.
steps.description: Monitor the whole proceeding very carefully.

steps.headline: Transfer the bulk from the stalk to a bowl, separate the soup and grind it into a paste.
Pour back the soup into the bowl and here is your WAASUNG GUDOG ready for electrifying your taste buds.
steps.description: It's simple and exotic. Try it at home.

text: Prepare a bamboo stalk chopped open at one end. Ideally it's prepared on 'waanal or waandal' (a class of bamboo with thick skinned and spacious at the same time). Gudog ingredients can be chosen at one's discretion. Usually it's bamboo shoot, but we'll take an example of potato..... Take a tbsp of turmeric powder, few onion rings ,a fresh fry (baby fish), chopped potatoes and most importantly green chillies and obviously salt.  Take a plantain leaf and roll it into a ball.  Transfer all the ingredients into the stalk and cover it with the ball of plantain leaf in such a way that it's loose enough to release pressure from the stalk.  Prepare a light fire and place the stalk over it.  Cook it until it boils  for about 10 to 15 minutes. Monitor the whole proceeding very carefully. Transfer the bulk from the stalk to a bowl, separate the soup and grind it into a paste.  Pour back the soup into the bowl and here is your WAASUNG GUDOG ready for electrifying your taste buds. It's simple and exotic. Try it at home.
